Header: Wild Elephants destroy more than 100 paddy acres
Content: Farmers belonging to 410 Farmer Organizations says that wild elephants have destroyed more than 100 acres of paddy in Anuradhapura, Thalaawa area. They said that although the wildlife office was informed, they did not take any suitable steps. However Range Officer R.B. Abeysekera of the Jayaganga Wildlife Office said that they have not received a complaint in this regard. He said that it has occurred as there was no proper method to protect the elephant fence which has been completed. He further said that improper development has also contributed to the situation. Anuradhapura Wildlife Range Officer Upali Jayawardena said that they take all measures to prevent human  –  elephant conflicts.
